title: Murder (Definition)
text: A culpable homicide is murder if the act is done with the intention of causing death, or with the intention of causing bodily injury that the offender knows is likely to cause death, or if the injury inflicted is sufficient in the ordinary course of nature to cause death.

title: Punishment for Murder
text: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Culpable Homicide Not Amounting to Murder
text: Punishment for causing death without the intention to cause death or such bodily injury likely to cause death. May include imprisonment for life or up to ten years depending on the intention and knowledge.

title: Attempt to Murder
text: Whoever does any act with such intention or knowledge that, if it caused death, would be guilty of murder, shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, or imprisonment for life if hurt is caused.

title: Voluntarily Causing Hurt
text: Punishment for voluntarily causing bodily pain, disease, or infirmity to any person. Imprisonment may extend to one year or fine or both.

title: Voluntarily Causing Hurt by Dangerous Weapons
text: Whoever causes hurt using a dangerous weapon such as a knife, fire, acid, or any instrument capable of causing death shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years or fine or both.

title: Voluntarily Causing Grievous Hurt
text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and fine.

title: Voluntarily Causing Grievous Hurt by Dangerous Weapons
text: Whoever causes grievous hurt using a dangerous weapon or means shall be punished with imprisonment for life or imprisonment up to ten years and fine.

title: Assault or Criminal Force to Woman with Intent to Outrage Modesty
text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force on a woman intending to outrage her modesty shall be punished with imprisonment of one to five years and fine.

title: Rape (Definition)
text: Defines rape as sexual intercourse without consent, under coercion, misrepresentation, or when the woman is incapable of consent due to age or mental/physical state.

title: Punishment for Rape
text: Whoever commits rape shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment of not less than ten years, extendable to life imprisonment, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for Theft
text: Whoever commits theft shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years or fine or both.

title: Theft in Dwelling House
text: Whoever commits theft in a dwelling house, building, or place of custody shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and fine.

title: Theft by Clerk or Servant
text: If a clerk or servant commits theft of property in the possession of their employer, they shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and fine.

title: Dacoity (Definition)
text: When five or more persons conjointly commit or attempt to commit robbery, or are present for committing robbery, they are said to commit dacoity.

title: Punishment for Robbery
text: Whoever commits robbery shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to ten years and fine.

title: Punishment for Dacoity
text: Whoever commits dacoity shall be punished with imprisonment for life or rigorous imprisonment up to ten years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Criminal Breach of Trust
text: Whoever dishonestly misappropriates or converts property entrusted to them shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years or fine or both.

title: Cheating and Dishonestly Inducing Delivery of Property
text: Whoever cheats and dishonestly induces a person to deliver property shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and fine.

title: Mischief Causing Damage
text: Whoever commits mischief and causes damage of fifty rupees or more shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years or fine or both.

title: Cruelty by Husband or Relatives
text: Husband or relatives who subject a woman to cruelty—physical or mental harassment—shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years and fine.

title: Criminal Intimidation
text: Whoever threatens another with injury to person, reputation, or property, with intent to cause alarm, shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years or fine or both.

title: Causing Disappearance of Evidence
text: Whoever causes evidence of an offence to disappear or gives false information to screen an offender shall be punished based on the seriousness of the offence.

title: Disobedience to Order Promulgated by Public Servant
text: Whoever knowingly disobeys any order issued by a public servant and thereby causes danger or obstruction shall be punished with imprisonment or fine.

title: False Information to Public Servant
text: Whoever gives false information with the intent to cause a public servant to use their lawful powers to the injury of another shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months or fine.

title: Causing Death by Negligence
text: Whoever causes death by doing any rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years or fine or both.

title: Obscene Acts and Songs
text: Whoever performs obscene acts or sings obscene songs in or near public places shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months or fine or both.

title: Sale of Obscene Books or Objects
text: Whoever sells, distributes, publicly exhibits, or circulates obscene materials shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years and fine.

title: Sale of Obscene Objects to Young Persons
text: Whoever sells obscene materials to a person under twenty years of age shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years and fine.

title: Insulting the Modesty of a Woman
text: Whoever utters a word, makes a gesture, or exhibits an object intended to insult the modesty of a woman shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year or fine or both.

title: Act of a Person of Unsound Mind
text: Nothing is an offence if the person, due to unsoundness of mind, is incapable of understanding the nature of the act or knowing that the act is wrong or contrary to law.
